general.title: General Settings
general.zoomDescription: Adjusts the zoom level to make content easier to read.
general.autoUpdateDescription: This will automatically update the app when new versions are available.
general.releaseChannelDescription: Controls which update channel the app uses.
general.runtimeModeDescription: Select the runtime to use for running the app.
general.nodeConfigured: Node.js is properly configured and ready to use.
general.nodeSelectFolder: Select the folder where Node.js is installed if it's not in your system PATH.

workflow.title: Workflow Settings
workflow.defaultChatModeDescription: Controls the default chat mode when you open a new chat.
workflow.autoApproveDescription: This will automatically approve code changes and run them.
workflow.autoFixProblemsDescription: This will automatically fix TypeScript errors.

ai.title: AI Settings
ai.thinkingBudgetDescription: Controls how long the AI model can think. Higher budgets mean more thorough reasoning.
ai.maxChatTurnsDescription: Limits how many recent chat turns are included in context.
ai.connectCustomEndpoint: Connect to a custom LLM API endpoint
ai.deleteProviderConfirmation: This will permanently delete this custom provider and all its associated models. This action cannot be undone.
ai.providerNotFoundDescription: The provider with ID "{{provider}}" could not be found.

telemetry.title: Telemetry
telemetry.description: This records anonymous usage data to improve the product.
telemetry.privacyNotice: We use anonymous telemetry data to improve the product. No personal data is collected.
telemetry.helpImprove: Help improve Dyad with anonymous usage data.
telemetry.noCodeOrMessages: Note: this does not log your code or messages.

agentPermissions.title: Agent Permissions (Pro)
agentPermissions.description: Configure permissions for Agent built-in tools.

toolsMcp.title: Tools (MCP)
toolsMcp.name: Name
toolsMcp.keyValueRequired: Both key and value are required
toolsMcp.duplicateKey: Environment variable with this key already exists

experiments.title: Experiments
experiments.enableNativeGitDescription: This doesn't require any external Git installation and offers a faster, native-Git performance experience.

dangerZone.title: Danger Zone
dangerZone.resetDescription: This will delete all your apps, chats, and settings. This action cannot be undone.
dangerZone.resetConfirmation: Are you sure you want to reset everything? This will delete all your apps, chats, and settings. This action cannot be undone.
dangerZone.resetSuccess: Successfully reset everything. Restart the application.

apiKey.overrideEnvVar: Setting a key here will override the environment variable (if set).
apiKey.envVarActive: This key is currently active (no settings key set).
apiKey.envVarOverridden: This key is currently being overridden by the key set in Settings.
apiKey.envVarNotSetDescription: The {{name}} environment variable is not set.
apiKey.envVarHelpText: This key is set outside the application. If present, it will be used only if no key is configured in the Settings section above. Requires app restart to detect changes.

azure.configuredDescription: Dyad will use the credentials saved in Settings for Azure OpenAI models.
azure.usingEnvVarsDescription: AZURE_API_KEY and AZURE_RESOURCE_NAME are set. Values saved below will override them.
azure.configRequiredDescription: Provide your Azure resource name and API key below, or configure the AZURE_API_KEY and AZURE_RESOURCE_NAME environment variables.
azure.apiKeyPlaceholder: Enter your Azure OpenAI API key
azure.configNeededDescription: Azure OpenAI requests require both a resource name and API key. Enter them above or supply the environment variables instead.
azure.envVarsHelpText: You can continue to configure Azure via environment variables. If both variables are present and no settings are saved, Dyad will use them automatically.
azure.envVarsPrecedence: Values saved in Settings take precedence over environment variables. Restart Dyad after changing environment variables.

vertex.locationHelp: If you see a "model not found" error, try a different region. Some partner models (MaaS) are only available in specific locations (e.g., us-central1, us-west2).
vertex.serviceAccountKeyPlaceholder: Paste the full JSON contents of your service account key here
vertex.configRequiredDescription: Provide Project, Location, and a service account JSON key with Vertex AI access.

models.title: Models
models.description: Manage specific models available through this provider.
models.noCustomModels: No custom models have been added for this provider yet.
models.deleteConfirmTitle: Are you sure you want to delete this model?
models.deleteConfirmDescription: This action cannot be undone. This will permanently delete the custom model "{{name}}" (API Name: {{apiName}}).
models.invalidMaxOutput: Max Output Tokens must be a valid number
models.invalidContextWindow: Context Window must be a valid number
models.addModelDescription: Configure a new language model for the selected provider.
models.editModelDescription: Modify the configuration of the selected language model.
models.modelIdHelp: This must match the model expected by the API

customProvider.addDescription: Connect to a custom language model provider API.
customProvider.editDescription: Update your custom language model provider configuration.
customProvider.providerIdHelp: A unique identifier for this provider (no spaces).
customProvider.displayNameHelp: The name that will be displayed in the UI.
customProvider.apiBaseUrlHelp: The base URL for the API endpoint.
customProvider.envVarHelp: Environment variable name for the API key.
